p: Campina Grande city (7°13′14.92″S, 35°55′1.32″W) is considered one of the main industrial centres of the north-east of Brazil as well as the main technological core within South America. In 2019, its estimated population was 409,731 inhabitants, making it the second-most populous city of Paraíba, with a population density of 648.31 per km 2 [ 21]. About 40% of the population exists on a very low wage, or about USD 118 per month (half of the minimum wage) [ 21].
